headline: Afghan Artists Risk Everything to Reject Silence
abstract: Despite the perils, Afghan artists have consistently portrayed their country and its many facets.
lead_paragraph: On the afternoon of Feb. 26, 2015, the artist Kubra Khademi strapped a suit of metal armor over her clothes and headed outside. The armor, which she had cobbled together in the workshop of a local blacksmith, had bulbous breasts and an ample bottom. It was the centerpiece of a carefully planned street performance.
